text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with grilled korean-style beef
short ribs so this is not so much about
the recipe or the marinade it's more
about the cut of beef and I want to make
sure you know about it because it's
really good this is a beef short rib
which is known as flanken style of
course whenever I talk to the butcher
about this I always call it Franken
style which they never think is funny
but anyway the same beef short rib
you've seen as braised in many recipes
except it's sliced much thinner which
allows us to marinate and grill this so
for the marinade I'm going to use a
little bit of ginger not that whole
piece so fresh garlic and then sort of
the most interesting addition here an
Asian pear which is like the pre-madonna
of fruit because it has to come in its
own little precious foam nest thing
which I don't quite understand why that
one fruit gets the special treatment
anyway we peeled and trimmed all that
the ginger was cut into coins about a
dollar and a quarter is worth three
cloves of garlic you can see and then
the peeled Asian pear alright we're
going to toss all that into a blender
and then we're going to add some brown
sugar some rice vinegar some soy sauce
some sherry wine because I was fresh out
of Korean wine a little bit of hoisin
sauce more than a little bit of sambal
or any other kind of Asian chili paste
and a tiny splash of sesame oil we're
going to blend that up nice and smooth
I'm going to lay out my flanken style or
Korean style beef short ribs in a pan
now do as I say not as I did put some
marinade on the bottom first before you
lay that in so you don't have to flip
them like this so I'm going to do a
layer of sauce and meat another layer of
meat and sauce and then finish it with
sauce basically as long as they are all
evenly coated by the marinade we're good
so for me the perfect marination time
for this is between 8 and 12 hours so if
you're going to grill in the evening you
can do this in the morning
of course if this is a lunch item for a
picnic or whatever you'll want to do
that late in the evening ok so
wrap that tight put it in the fridge
when you're ready to grill take it out
of the fridge pull it out of the
marinade now you can't really grill wet
meat very well so you're going to want
to dry it off a little bit I just like
to blot it on paper towels is I pull it
out of the marinade and put it on a
plate and that works good all right the
rest is easy and delicious go out to a
charcoal grill ideally it'll work out
any grill the charcoal is preferred and
Grill about 4 minutes per side or if you
cook it too rare in my opinion it's just
a little too chewy and tough medium-rare
it's a little better medium to medium
well believe it or not for me is ideal
there's still enough fat and moisture in
that meat to keep it nice and juicy and
by the way you know me I like to play
with my meat on the grill I have no
problem with it every time I turn it I
feel like those juices from one side are
now going to caramelize on the other
side so just a theory of mine anyway
about 4 minutes per side and that's what
they look like and man was that good I
threw on some green onion just you know
for color and then we're going to serve
this with some kimchi maybe a little
rice I like to cut in between the bones
with scissors so it's easy to get at and
you know there's not a lot of food you
serve with scissors
you know there's scissor loaf and
scissor Cheney but those are the only
other ones I know and they say that that
Asian pear not only sweetens the
marinade a little bit but it actually
will help tenderize the beef which I
totally believe since that meat came
right off the bone and was delicious and
succulent anyway I hope you can find
some of that beef talk to your butcher
they can help you out it is a very
unique cut very easy to identify
there is no mistaken blinkin so there
you go Korean style grilled beef short
ribs any marinade will work any of your
favorite Asian marinades teriyaki
anything like that beautiful grilling
season right around the corner if not
already here so this should make a nice
addition to all your backyard
barbecuing fun anyway all the
ingredients are on the site as usual and
as always enjoy
